article:
"Knowing that you had to work on Thanksgiving, I thought I'd express my gratitude. You have made the    _   to learn my name and   _   me each day in a way that makes me feel like a person instead of a number. Thank you!"
About three years ago, I gave a   _   with these words to a Starbucks waitress. When I went in the next day, she couldn't help crying and told me that she was deeply   _   by my note and realized what she did really   _  .
I went through a   _   time when I felt anything but   _   . On New Year's Day 2008, I went for a   _  , feeling unhappy. I was overweight. I owned a law practice, but it was   _   money. On my hike, I heard a voice. It said I shouldn't   worry about   what I wanted or had lost   _   should be grateful for what I had. The idea of a year of thank-yous came into my head.
This project   _   my life. After I thanked my colleagues for directing cases to me, they   _   me more. When I expressed gratitude to clients for paying on time, they began doing so even more   _  .
In 2010, I 30 _  a book about my year of thank-yous. A few days after its publication, I got many thank-you letters from my   _   . They showed me how gratitude   _  . One woman went in person to   _    her message to a former teacher, who read it and cried.
My life has improved since that hike. I'm now in great   _  , and I have got my dream job. Having written my 860th note, I can say thank-you letters make a difference and   _   is a path to the peace we all try to get.
